intro: Amaranthus tuberculatus var. rudis, commonly known as rough pigweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered greenish to reddish flowers that develop into three-angled, smooth seed capsules. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it is considered a common weed in many regions.
